tn.text: Yahweh continues to tell Moses what the people must do. (See: [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:01]])

tn.ref: five cubits long and five cubits wide
tn.text: "2.2 meters long on each side" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])

tn.ref: The altar must be square and three cubits high
tn.text: "The altar must be square and 1.3 meters high" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])
A cubit is 46 centimeters. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])

tn.ref: You must make extensions of its four corners shaped like ox horns
tn.text: "You must make projections that look like ox horns on its four corners"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "You must make the horns" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"must cover the altar and horns"
Yahweh continues to tell Moses what the people must do.
"bowls"
There were pans that held hot coals from the altar.
These were any instrument, vessel, or tool that served a useful purpose.

tn.ref: You must make a grate for the altar, a network of bronze
tn.text: "You must make a bronze grate for the altar"
a frame of crossed bars for holding wood when burning
Yahweh continues to tell Moses what the people need to do.

tn.ref: You must put the grate under the ledge of the altar
tn.text: The grate was placed inside the altar. This can be stated clearly in the translation. AT: "You must put the grate under the rim of the altar, on the inside of the altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This is a frame of crossed bars for holding wood when burning. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:27:03|27:4]].

tn.ref: You must make poles for the altar
tn.text: These poles were used for carrying the altar. This can be stated clearly in the translation. AT: "You must make poles for carrying the altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Yahweh continues to tell Moses what the people should do.

tn.ref: The poles must be put into the rings, and the poles must be on the two sides of the altar, to carry it
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You must put the poles into the rings and place them on each side of the altar to carry it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
a long, flat piece of wood that is thicker than a board

tn.ref: you were shown on the mountain
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that I have shown to you here on this mountain" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "You must place hangings ... courtyard" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
A "hanging" was a large curtain made of cloth. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:26:36|26:36]]
"finely twisted linen." This was cloth made from fine linen threads that someone twisted together to make a stronger thread
"44 meters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])

tn.ref: There must also be hooks ... posts
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You must also attach hooks ... posts" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
a strong piece of wood set upright and used as a support
Yahweh continues to tell Moses what the people must do.
For 27:11 see how you translated many similar words in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:27:09|27:9-10]].
This could be stated as a command. AT: "you must make hangings"
This could be stated as a command. AT: "you must make a curtain"
This could be stated as a command. AT: "You must make ten posts"

tn.ref: The courtyard must also be fifty cubits long
tn.text: This could be stated as a command. AT: "Make the courtyard fifty cubits long"
Yahweh continues to tell Moses what the people must do.
These were large curtains made of cloth. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:26:36|26:36]].
These were strong pieces of wood set upright and used as supports. See how you translated these in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:27:09|27:10]].
These were metal blocks that had a slot in them to keep the board in place. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:26:19|26:19]].
about seven meters (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])

tn.ref: The courtyard gate must be a curtain twenty cubits long
tn.text: This could be stated as a command. AT: "You must make a curtain twenty cubits long to be the courtyard gate"

tn.ref: The curtain must be made ... fine twined linen, the work of an embroiderer
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They must make the curtain ... fine twined linen, the work of an embroiderer" or "Embroiderers must make the curtain ... fine twined linen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: blue, purple, and scarlet material and fine twined linen
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "yarn that is dyed blue, purple, and scarlet," probably wool yarn, or 2) "blue, purple, and scarlet dye" to dye the linen.
a person who sews designs into cloth
Yahweh continues to tell Moses what the people must do.
"100 cubits." A cubit is 46 centimeters. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"finely twisted linen." This was cloth made from fine linen threads that someone twisted together to make a stronger thread. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:26:36|26:36]].

tn.ref: and all the tent pegs for the tabernacle and courtyard must be made of bronze
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and make all the tent pegs for the tabernacle and courtyard out of bronze" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
sharp pieces of wood or metal used to secure the corners of a tent to the ground
Yahweh continues to tell Moses what the people must do.
This is another name for the tabernacle.
This is the chest that contains the sacred slabs of stone on which Yahweh had written his commandments.

tn.ref: This requirement will be a lasting ordinance
tn.text: "I require that the people do this as a lasting ordinance"
